content.question: Three blocks of equal mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> are connected by strings, one of which passes over a pulley, as shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> hangs from the string and Blocks <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> can slide across the rough table. The three-block system is released from rest and Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> falls a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>. At the instant that Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has fallen a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> the three-block system is moving at speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly represents the energy dissipated by friction during the time between releasing the system and the instant Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has fallen a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="m g h minus one half m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m g h minus three halves m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
